column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Six coronavirus-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 210 cases of coronavirus were reported on Wednesday
column5: 748 on Tuesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 211
column7: 939 cases of the virus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.There are 454 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column8: down from 461 on Tuesday.There are 44 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column9: down from 45 on Tuesday.Thirty three of those with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units are on ventilators.Last updated 8 September at 15:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column11: 196 Covid-19 vaccines have been administered in Northern Ireland.Of those
column17: 487 are second doses. A total of 2
column18: 124 doses were administered on Monday.Last updated 8 September at 15:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column19: 115.This number includes 43 deaths newly notified in the past week.That figure

column22: 545 new cases of coronavirus were reported on Wednesday
column25: 967 cases of the virus have been confirmed in the Republic of Ireland since the pandemic began.There are 335 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
